meanings.definition: A person who constantly complains or nags.
meanings.sent1: My sister is one of those naggers who always find something to complain about.
meanings.sent2: The naggers in the office make it hard to focus on work.
meanings.sent3: The group chat was filled with naggers, but we still managed to have a good time.
meanings.sent4: The naggers in the neighborhood were like background noise that never stopped.
meanings.sent5: The image of the naggers kept replaying in my mind, like a broken record.

meanings.sent1: The room was filled with naggers, each with their own list of complaints.
meanings.sent2: The naggers gathered outside the principal's office, waiting to voice their concerns.
meanings.sent3: The party was lively until the naggers arrived with their negative energy.
meanings.sent4: The naggers swarmed the customer service desk, demanding to speak to a manager.
meanings.sent5: The crowd of naggers grew louder, like a chorus of discontent.
